poem:
Title: Iron Horses and Their Vanishing Roar 

Batteries hush in the quiet machines,
Haunted by the specter of oil's gleam.
Less clamour, a trade for unseen green-
But hearts of men are stubbornly keen.
Each purring engine, a lullaby lost,
A price too steep, an unmeasured cost.
Who will morn the petrol's frost?
Bare, silent roads are humanity's host.
